Interface Meta

All Superinterfaces:
Entity, Supplier<CharSequence>
All Known Subinterfaces:
Meta.Builder<B>
public interface Meta extends Entity
The meta information for a log message

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT

      static final Meta DEFAULT
      Can be used when logging without any meta information

  • Method Details

    • getChannel

      default String getChannel()
      User defined value to help subscribers determine how to process a log message Common values would be "info", "warn", "error", "trace", "debug" In addition System.err and System.out get redirected to System
      Returns:
      the channel

    • getKey

      default Optional<String> getKey()
      Optional key to ensure ordering of messages. If provided, all received messages will be consumed on the same thread.
      Returns:
      the optional key

    • isBlock

      default boolean isBlock()
      if true the Log.get() will be invoked immediately (if needed). The Metalog implementation may choose to still dispatch the log on worker threads, but Log.get() will never be invoked again.

      Note: This is useful for contextual stateful information that may not be available in the future. For example thread local data or database sessions

      Returns:
      true if blocking, the default is false

    • getTime

      default Optional<Temporal> getTime()
      The optional time the log message was published

      Note: Although the default provided here does not return a value, the value will likely will be stored in the entity tree structure. Locating this value is a common use case and promoted to explicit method for convenience.

      Returns:
      the optional time

    • getThrown

      default Optional<Throwable> getThrown()
      The optional exception correlated to a log message

      Note: Although the default provided here does not return a value, the value will likely will be stored in the entity tree structure. Locating this value is a common use case and promoted to explicit method for convenience.

      Returns:
      the optional time

    • getThread

      default Optional<Thread> getThread()
      The optional thread correlated to a log message

      Note: Although the default provided here does not return a value, the value will likely will be stored in the entity tree structure. Locating this value is a common use case and promoted to explicit method for convenience.

      Returns:
      the optional time
